title: This is a common mistake I see regular Swain Players do

replies.body: You forgot to W after pull too you glub.

> [{quoted}](name=The Stripy Bag,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=0sRx3P0L,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-11-30T20:42:15.948+0000)
>
> You forgot to W after pull too you glub.

That is only for late game, otherwise you are using a lot of mana (despite you get more from landing the w) but they still have a chance to dodge it as well if you make the slightest miscalculation, so it's mostly optional.

> [{quoted}](name=Manxxom,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=0sRx3P0L,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-11-30T22:47:34.009+0000)
>
> That is only for late game, otherwise you are using a lot of mana (despite you get more from landing the w) but they still have a chance to dodge it as well if you make the slightest miscalculation, so it's mostly optional.

To land the W, i made myself a note to always use W right before E so when the W animation begins, the E projectile flies in and roots them, just in time for the W to detonate ontop of them while you still got enough time to use the passive pull and a Q.

Learning the timing tho is horrendously difficult and, as you said, a massive manawaste if you don't land it

Generally you don't want to Q unless you're planning to do some killing. Especially your level 1 Q - it doesn't do much damage to justify throwing it out over your W, and the reason is that your W gives you a) a soul fragment stack, which in turn gives you b) mana and health back in return. And if you're running electrocute over phase rush, a lot of your early trading damage will be coming from that anyway - might as well opt into stacking up bonus health over trying to deal a modicum of damage more that many laners will heal back right now since Taste of Blood is a hot choice.

Another mistake is yanking enemies out of my skill shots

Especially if you're lux
When you pull the enemy out of your W.
also, as the swain main of my friend group can I have that format?
